title: 500% tariffs ahead for India & China? Trump clears Russia sanctions bill; what it means
content: The Trump administration is threatening to penalize countries buying discounted Russian oil, a move that could impact India's energy imports and trade with the US. A bipartisan sanctions bill, approved by Trump, aims to pressure nations like India, China, and Brazil to cease Russian crude purchases, which the US argues funds Putin's war in Ukraine.

title: Video: US ICE officer shoots woman at point-blank range in Minneapolis — how it unfolded
content: An ICE officer fatally shot a woman driving an SUV during an immigration raid in Minneapolis. US President Trump called the incident "horrible" and labeled the woman a "professional agitator" who "viciously" ran over the officer. The administration confirmed the shooting, stating the woman attempted to run over law enforcement.

title: ‘I forget’: Haryana man who has son after 10 daughters struggles to recall children’s names
content: Haryana showcases its gender paradox with contrasting births: a daughter celebrated with a traditional son's ritual, while an 11th son was welcomed after 10 daughters, highlighting both progress and persistent son preference. Despite awareness campaigns, deep-rooted bias remains evident in the state's transition.

title: 'No WC at the cost of dignity': B'desh draws firm line; pushes ICC to shift matches to SL
content: Bangladesh's government has hardened its stance on playing the T20 World Cup in India, citing national dignity and cricketer security concerns. Dhaka will urge the ICC to relocate their matches to Sri Lanka, believing the global body misunderstands the gravity of the situation. Participation will not come at the cost of humiliation or compromised safety.

title: House of Cards gamble: Netflix founder spent $100M on series; what Co-CEO said
content: Netflix co-CEO Ted Sarandos revealed he once greenlit two seasons of 'House of Cards' for $100 million without founder Reed Hastings' approval.  This bold move, a calculated risk, transformed Netflix from a DVD service into a streaming content leader. Sarandos credits this experience for shaping his leadership style, emphasizing trust in talented teams.

title: IT ministry calls Musk’s X reply ‘inadequate,’ demands action plan on Grok AI issue
content: India's IT Ministry has expressed concerns over obscene content generated by Elon Musk's chatbot Grok, demanding X (formerly Twitter) provide specific actions and preventive measures. The ministry seeks documented proof of compliance with IT rules and content standards, rejecting generic assurances from the social media platform.

title: Sewage in drinking water in Greater Noida: Several fall ill with vomiting, diarrhoea
content: Dozens of Greater Noida residents, including children, fell ill with vomiting, diarrhea, and fever after sewage contaminated the drinking water supply in Sector Delta 1. Authorities have repaired a leaking pipeline and distributed medicines, while residents fear a repeat of past tragedies and demand better infrastructure.

title: Apple execs won't leave South Korea: Hunting Samsung, SK Hynix supply; iPhone RAM at risk
content: Apple executives are reportedly staying in South Korean hotels near Samsung and SK Hynix factories to secure long-term memory chip supplies amid a global shortage.  RAM prices have surged dramatically, forcing tech giants like Dell, Google, and Amazon to also establish extended stays.  Memory manufacturers are prioritizing AI demand, leading to shortages and potential price hikes for consumer electronics.

title: Enna thambi! 'You can't explain this at 14': Ashwin's awe sums up Sooryavanshi's rise
content: Fourteen-year-old batting sensation Vaibhav Sooryavanshi is making waves in cricket with astonishing performances.  Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin highlighted his recent scores, calling his talent inexplicable.  Sooryavanshi recently captained India U19 to a series win against South Africa with a century, showcasing his immense potential ahead of the U19 World Cup.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex below 84,950
content: Stock market today: Indian equity benchmark indices, Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, continued their slide on Thursday. While Nifty50 was just above 26,100, BSE Sensex went below the 84,950 mark.

title: Musk says he's impressed with China; highlights its rapid EV & solar growth
content: Elon Musk humorously noted China's rapid adoption of his energy ideas, from EVs and solar to massive battery production. He highlighted China's dominance in these sectors, contrasting it with US potential. Musk emphasized batteries, like Tesla's Megapacks, as crucial for doubling US energy throughput without new power plants, especially for AI's growing demands.

title: NFL playoffs: Wild-card matchups, playoff teams and full postseason field
content: The NFL's 2025 regular season has concluded, with all 14 playoff teams and matchups confirmed. The Denver Broncos and Seattle Seahawks secured crucial first-round byes as top seeds. Wild-card weekend begins January 10, featuring intense single-elimination games, including the Carolina Panthers who surprisingly made the cut. Super Bowl LX is set for February 8.

title: Raising teenagers isn’t easy and here's how Jennifer Garner keeps it real
content: Jennifer Garner finds joy in raising teenagers, appreciating their coolness and growing awareness. She describes her parenting style as evolving, emphasizing listening and allowing independence over control. Garner focuses on her children's character and effort, a relatable approach for parents navigating modern pressures. Her grounded perspective highlights the importance of respect and encouragement for teens discovering themselves.

title: BMC polls: Sena candidate Haji Saalim stabbed during campaign in Bandra
content: Sena candidate Haji Saalim Qureshi was stabbed four times in the stomach while campaigning in Bandra East. Eyewitnesses reported an unknown assailant attacked him and fled. Police suspect political opponents and have lodged an attempt to murder case, forming multiple teams to apprehend the attacker.

title: 'Wife killer' living as carpenter caught by Police; jumped parole 26 years ago
content: A carpenter in Ludhiana, living under an assumed identity for 14 years, was apprehended by Delhi Police. He was a fugitive, having escaped parole in 2000 after being sentenced for his wife's murder in 1992.  The police tracked him down through a tip-off, ending his decade-long evasion.

title: Amid India-Bangladesh tensions, ex-Bangladesh player recalls help from Tendulkar, Ganguly
content: Former Bangladesh batter Rajin Saleh recalled receiving crucial batting advice from Sachin Tendulkar and Sourav Ganguly during a difficult 2004 series against India. Tendulkar advised him to mentally reset after each innings, while Ganguly urged him to play fearlessly. Saleh then scored in the 80s in the next match, crediting their support.

title: Filmmaker Gnanamuthu reacts to delays in censorship of Vijay's 'Jana Nayagan'
content: Thalapathy Vijay's highly anticipated film 'Jana Nayagan' faces a release day postponement due to pending certification from the CBFC. Filmmaker Ajay R Gnanamuthu voiced solidarity with the team amidst the delay. The Madras High Court has reserved its verdict, ordering a review by a new committee, impacting advance bookings and causing fan disappointment.

title: 'Dhurandhar' BO collection: Ranveer Singh starrer sets record as highest-earning Hindi film
content: 'Dhurandhar' continues its phenomenal box office streak, crossing Rs 1227 crore globally. The film has now become the highest-earning single-language (Hindi) movie, surpassing 'Pushpa 2: The Rule' and other blockbusters. Its fifth week collections remain strong, showcasing sustained audience interest even after a month of release.

title: Buy Greenland? Take it? Why? An old pact already gives Trump a free hand
content: President Trump's desire to acquire Greenland for national security is complicated. A 1951 defense pact already grants the US extensive military access and base-building rights. Despite this, Trump's talk of buying the island faces strong opposition from Greenlanders and Denmark, who emphasize self-determination and the island's inalienable status.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for today - check list
content: Top stock market recommendations: Aakash K Hindocha of Nuvama Professional Clients Group recommends buying ABB, Fortis, and Petronet. He also shares his views on Nifty, Bank Nifty.

title: How Maduro's 'guru' Sri Sathya Sai Baba became a household name in Venezuela
content: Venezuelan leader Nicolas Maduro's courtroom invocation of God reveals a deep devotion to Indian guru Sri Sathya Sai Baba, revered as a "man of miracles." Maduro and other Venezuelan politicians were followers, with Sai Baba's portrait displayed in the presidential palace.  The guru's teachings of "love all, serve all" resonated widely, even amidst accusations of misconduct.

title: ‘Dream military’: Trump proposes $1.5 trillion defence outlay for 2027, up from $1 trillion
content: President Donald Trump has proposed a $1.5 trillion military budget for 2027, an increase from the previously discussed $1 trillion. He stated this expanded allocation is crucial for building a "Dream Military" to ensure national security amidst global instability. Trump also linked this increased defense spending to revenues generated from tariffs.

title: 'So useless bro': Chelsea fans furious at star after heavy Fulham defeat
content: Chelsea’s 2–1 defeat to Fulham sparked intense fan anger, with Pedro Neto becoming the main target of criticism online. Supporters questioned his form and role after another frustrating display, while Marc Cucurella’s red card and defensive issues added to the chaos. As Liam Rosenior prepares to take charge, Chelsea face growing unrest both on and off the pitch.

title: April 1-Sept 30: Govt notifies timeline for phase 1 Census; first-ever digital exercise
content: The Union home ministry has notified the timeline for the first phase of Census 2027, focusing on housing and houselisting operations. This phase will be conducted over 30 days between April 1 and September 30 this year, with an option for 15-day self-enumeration before the main operation.

title: Travis Kelce reaches breaking point as Taylor Swift hits new career
content: As the Chiefs wrapped up a disappointing season, Travis Kelce faced mounting questions about his NFL future and the possibility of retirement. At the same time, Taylor Swift reached another career high, extending her historic run atop the Billboard 200. The contrast highlighted a pivotal moment for the high-profile couple, with one career pausing as the other surged forward.

title: Tommy Fleetwood and Clare Fleetwood’s net worth: Golf earnings, family, fortune
content: Tommy and Clare Fleetwood have built a significant fortune through Tommy's successful golf career, prize money, and lucrative brand deals. Clare, as his manager, plays a crucial role in their financial success and their private family life. Their collaborative approach has led to both on-course achievements and long-term financial stability.

title: Ric Flair Net Worth 2025: WWE Legend’s Earnings, Endorsements & Legacy
content: Despite his legendary wrestling status, Ric Flair's 2025 net worth is reportedly $500,000. High personal expenses, multiple divorces, and significant medical bills have impacted his finances. While Flair earned millions during wrestling's boom and continues with endorsements, past contract limitations and recent business ventures have shaped his current wealth.

title: 'It's too much': India questioned for not collecting Asia Cup trophy from Naqvi
content: West Indies all-rounder Jason Holder expressed discomfort with the India-Pakistan rivalry's intensity, citing excessive on-field theatrics and the trophy incident after the Asia Cup final. He also lamented Pakistani players' limited franchise league opportunities due to political dynamics. Holder believes the rivalry has crossed a line, impacting cricket beyond the pitch.

title: US warplanes and elite units have been landing in Britain since the weekend
content: Heavily armed US military aircraft, including cargo jets and gunships, have landed in Britain following the reported capture of Venezuela's President Maduro. The deployment suggests preparations for further operations, with exercises involving special operations soldiers observed. The UK government has declined to comment on the activity.

title: Dhaka: Bangladesh Nationalist Party youth leader shot dead in Karwan Bazar area — report
content: A senior leader of the Bangladesh Nationalist Party's volunteer wing, Azizur Rahman Musabbir, was fatally shot in Dhaka's Karwan Bazar area Tuesday night. Another man, Sufian Byapari Masud, sustained injuries in the attack. Police confirmed the incident, which led to a protest by around 200 BNP activists at the scene.

title: ‘Only American products’: Trump says Venezuela to spend oil deal money on US goods
content: Venezuela will exclusively purchase American-made goods, including agricultural products, medicines, and energy infrastructure equipment, using funds from a new oil deal. This significant shift positions the United States as Venezuela's primary commercial partner, a move hailed as mutually beneficial for both nations. The arrangement signals a notable change in Venezuela's economic allegiances.

title: Don’t throw away aquarium water! Here's what to do
content: Aquarium water, often discarded, offers a valuable nutrient boost for garden plants. Fish waste and uneaten food break down into essential elements like nitrogen, phosphorus, and potassium, benefiting leafy growth and soil health. This nutrient-rich water can be safely used as an occasional supplement for most garden plants, improving soil structure and moisture retention.

title: Hit by Op Sindoor, panic-stricken Pak mounted frantic lobbying in US, reveal official papers
content: Following India's military retaliation against a terror attack, Pakistan urgently sought US mediation to halt New Delhi's strikes.  FARA filings reveal Islamabad's frantic lobbying efforts, involving over 60 contacts with US officials and media.  Pakistan's hired firm, Squire Patton Boggs, aimed to secure American intervention to "somehow halt" India's operations, indicating significant behind-the-scenes panic.

title: Sydney Warner welcomes baby girl as Fred Warner celebrates family of four
content: Sydney and Fred Warner joyfully welcomed their baby girl, Bella Nicole, marking a new family chapter. Amidst Fred's recovery from injury, the couple shared tender moments of their newborn's arrival, emphasizing gratitude and faith. This peaceful celebration underscores a focus on family, with son Beau embracing his big brother role.

title: Viral! Sooryavanshi’s reaction leaves referee laughing: Here's what happened
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi stole the show in the third India vs South Africa U19 ODI, despite an emotional moment at the toss after losing it. The 14-year-old captain bounced back with a stunning 127 off 74 balls, becoming the youngest skipper to score a Youth ODI century. Supported by Aaron George’s 118, India posted 393/7 and crushed South Africa by 233 runs to sweep the series.

title: 'Ikkis' box office Day 7: Agastya Nanda's film is struggling to cross Rs 25 crore mark
content: Breaking onto the silver screen, Agastya Nanda's 'Ikkis' hasn't quite lived up to the buzz, raking in a disappointing Rs 24.25 crore in its first week. Directed by Sriram Raghavan, this war drama was expected to resonate with viewers, but alas, its Day 7 tally of Rs 1.15 crore suggests it's falling short compared to its competitors.

title: Breaking law will lead to deportation, US warns students against visa violations
content: The US embassy in India has warned student visa holders that violating laws can lead to visa revocation, deportation, and permanent ineligibility for future US visas. This follows a similar warning for H1B and H4 visa applicants. Recent changes also mandate in-person interviews for most non-immigrant visa applicants.

title: EC officials deliver SIR notice to Amartya home in Santiniketan
content: Nobel laureate Amartya Sen received an election notice alleging an age difference of less than 15 years with his late mother, a claim his representatives call harassment. The Election Commission stated the discrepancy was flagged by a portal, and officials visited Sen's residence to resolve it, despite the actual age gap being over 19 years.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo’s wife opens up on losing identity after motherhood
content: Mariah Riddlesprigger, wife of NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo, candidly shared the challenges of motherhood and losing her identity during COVID-19. She also addressed the couple's decision to shield their four children from the media spotlight, emphasizing privacy concerns. Despite these struggles, Mariah has launched a clothing brand and leads a foundation.

title: Govt considers raising EPFO monthly wage cap to Rs 25k-30k
content: A proposal to raise the Employees Provident Fund Organisation's monthly wage ceiling beyond Rs 15,000 is back on the table, with suggestions for an increase to Rs 25,000-30,000. This move aims to bring more low-wage and minimum-wage earners, especially in the unorganised sector, under the social security net.

title: Madras high court bans book with 'scandalous' remarks against Deepam judge
content: Madras HC has prohibited the publication, sale, and circulation of a Tamil book containing derogatory remarks against Justice G R Swaminathan. The court initiated suo motu contempt proceedings against the publisher, Keezhaikaatru Publishers, for content deemed highly abusive and scandalous.

title: RDPR Department considering Singapore technology to ensure water quality in Karnataka
content: The Minister told representatives of Singapore-based ZWEEC that a pilot project would be taken up to study the solutions on offer

title: Domicile certificates not valid for SIR hearings in Bengal: Official
content: The list of acceptable documents under the SIR include permanent address or residence certificates issued by the State, but domicile certificates do not fall under this category

title: 2026 to see upswing in India-E.U. relationship: Jaishankar in Luxembourg
content: Mr. Jaishankar met Prime Minister Luc Frieden, had a long, detailed discussion with Foreign Minister Javier Bethel, and called on Guillaume V, the Grand Duke of Luxembourg

title: Unusual January system brews over Bay of Bengal; heavy rain likely across parts of T.N.
content: An orange alert has been issued to Thiruvarur and Nagapattinam as heavy to very heavy rainfall is possible on Friday

title: Schoolgirl gangraped in Kanpur; YouTuber nabbed, hunt on for cop
content: The case has triggered high-level administrative action, with Police Commissioner Raghubir Lal removing Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Dinesh Chandra Tripathi and suspending Sachendi Station House Officer (SHO) Vikram Singh for alleged lapses and distortion of facts

title: Kondapalli railway station to be developed with ₹10 crore
content: The Central government has approved the deveopment project under Amrit Bharat 2.0 scheme, says Vijayawada MP

title: U.S. tariff impact: India is finding newer markets, strengthening old trade routes to compensate
content: India has replaced its lost U.S. sales by deepening its ties with existing partners and exploring new destinations

title: All set for Amaravati Avakaya Festival in Vijayawada from January 8
content: The three-day event will feature film screenings, literary discussions, poetry readings, music and dance performances, theatre shows, workshops, cultural lectures and contemporary art exhibitions

title: Congress party is not by or for individuals: Priyank Kharge
content: Congress chief Kharge continued his tirade against the RSS after a special court issued notices to him and other Congress leaders in a defamation case

title: Karnataka urges Kerala Governor to reject Malayalam language Bill
content: Karnataka Border Area Development Authority, in its petition, has demanded that Kasargod, where more than 70% of the population is Kannada speaking, be excluded from the purview of the bill

title: Jabarkhet: can private reserves restore wildlife and keep tourism gentle?
content: Private reserves are popular in Africa. In India, however, responsible private reserves are more about potential than reality. In dissecting how wildlife returned to Jabarkhet Nature Reserve and how it has balanced tourism needs with conservation, it is possible to trace a model for private reserves in India

title: Fishermen seek special camps for updation of addresses in official records
content: The issue has arisen for families who moved from huts to apartments constructed by the Slum Clearance Board too

title: TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee slams BJP over migrant workers’ ordeal when detained in Maharashtra
content: The two workers detained over allegations of being Bangladeshi nationals were from Balurghat constituency, which is led by BJP MP and Union Minister Sukanta Majumdar

title: Protests erupt outside Bengal’s health department as ASHA workers demand pay hike, benefits
content: The demands include increased monthly honorarium, life insurance benefits, maternity leave, recognition as permanent government employees among others

title: Radha Nagar subway in Chromepet finally opened
content: The facility was planned way back in 2006, and the foundation stone too was laid, as a pedestrian-only facility to enable residents of East Chromepet to access the  Grand Southern Trunk (GST) Road

title: Bihar Govt. spent over ₹3,630 crore on development schemes under MMKVY in five years: Minister
content: Corpus of Mukhya Mantri Kshetra Vikas Yojana increased from ₹3 crore to ₹4 crore; 1108 of 2456 schemes have been completed till November 2025

title: Chennai Corporation to reassess women’s safety perceptions in city’s public spaces and transport
content: The upcoming midline study would adopt a mixed-method approach and will be conducted across all 15 zones of Chennai and major transit points

title: CM Nitish orders Bihar officials to hear public grievances at their offices two days a week
content: The CM asserted that a register of complaints received from visitors will be maintained, instructions have been given to all concerned officials to make this arrangement effective from January 19

title: SASTRA University, The Hindu Education Plus to organise webinar on research and innovation
content: The session would offer students insights into research-oriented career options, interdisciplinary innovation, and national science initiatives

title: Vedanta chairperson Anil Agarwal's son Agnivesh dies in U.S. at 49
content: The Board member of a Vedanta group firm got injured in a skiing accident and was recovering when he died of a cardiac arrest

title: Jharkhand to debut at World Economic Forum to be held in Davos
content: Chief Minister Hemant Soren will lead the 11-member delegation from January 18 to 26; visit coincides with 25 years of Jharkhand’s statehood

title: Maharashtra Congress vice-president dies of stab wounds in Akola
content: Main accused held, IPS officer to head probe, say police; Hidayatullah Patel was stabbed at a mosque in Akola district

title: ‘Divine connect’ through Money Order prevails over digital currency
content: Launched in 2009, ‘Aseervachanam’ scheme is still popular in the era of UPI transactions as the TTD received ₹3.1 crore as donations through M.O. from 1.26 lakh devotees in 2025

title: Rogue elephant kills 13 in two days in Jharkhand villages
content: Teams of forest officials with experts from West Bengal's Bankura district have been engaged to drive away the elephant back to the forest

title: Mysuru resident loses ₹1.77 crore to trading app fraud
content: When he wanted to withdraw his funds, the fraudsters demanded that he pay ‘capital gains tax on private accounts’

title: For-profit companies allowed to set up medical colleges under PPP mode, says NMC chief
content: As hospitals run under PPP mode will be under the purview of State governments,  patients will get treatment on either free or subsidised basis, says Abhijat Chandrakant Sheth

title: Chief Minister Naidu seeks statutory protection for Amaravati as Andhra Pradesh’s capital
content: Seeking introduction of the relevant Bill in Parliament, he tells Amit Shah that it is crucial for the State’s development and stability

title: Alienation in Kashmir touches unprecedented level, Omar prefers silence: Mehbooba Mufti
content: Mufti accused the current dispensation in J&K under Omar Abdullh of failing to address the burning issues of people

title: NCB seized 1.33 lakh kg of drugs worth about ₹2,000 crore in 2025
content: During the year, the agency also busted six drug laboratories operating in Rajasthan, Maharashtra, West Bengal, and Madhya Pradesh

title: A.P. govt. opens ‘net-zero’ residential school at Kuntamukkala near Vijayawada
content: The pilot project aims to serve as a scalable model of an Integrated Ecological Campus which will include green belts, rainforest, wetlands, and microgreens

title: Man electrocuted on illegal electrical fence near Arakkonam; farmer held
content: Police said that the farmer had reportedly erected illegal electrical fencing around the farmland to prevent wild animals from damaging crops during night

title: Vijay’s ‘Jana Nayagan’ postponed; new release date to be announced soon
content: Earlier in the day, the Madras HC had reserved orders on a writ petition filed by the film’s producer against the non-issuance of the censor certificate by the Central Board of Film Certification

title: Farmers seek release of water from Sathanur dam in Tiruvannamalai on January 14 for irrigation
content: While water from the dam’s Left Bank Canal feeds 30 tanks in Tiruvannamalai and 10 in Villupuram, the Right Bank Canal is connected to 48 tanks in Villupuram

title: AICC observers for poll-bound States
content: D.K. Shivakumar, Bhupesh Baghel and Bandhu Tirkey have been appointed for Assam; Sachin Pilot, Kanhaiya Kumar, Imran Pratapgarhi, K.J. George are observers for Kerala

title: Elections to five standing committees in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation postponed
content: Only the welfare, town planning and tax appeal standing committees were formed in the elections held on Wednesday.  Tactical deployment of councillors to capture control of certain standing committees led to a lack of quorum in others. BJP manages majority in town planning standing committee, despite R.Sreelekha’s vote becoming invalid due to her failure in noting her name and signature on  ballot paper

title: Assam BJP leader Kabindra Purkayastha dies at 94
content: The former Union Minister laid the foundation of the party in the northeast and was one of the key drivers of its growth in Assam, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma says

title: Tamil Nadu Government orders probe into ED’s corruption allegations linking Minister K.N. Nehru
content: The DVAC has launched a detailed inquiry into the alleged bribery in the award of contracts in MAWS department

title: CM Stalin hits out at Amit Shah for ‘slandering’ DMK
content: Criticising the Union Home Minister for accusing the DMK government of working against the beliefs of Hindus, he pointed out that it had performed the consecration of over 4,000 temples

title: Central drug regulator releases guidelines to compound minor drug violations
content: The move will aid business compliance, exempting pharma firms from appearing in court in case of “certain minor contraventions”; instead, they will have to pay a fine and take “self-corrective actions”

title: Supreme Court defers Sonam Wangchuk detention case hearing by a day
content: The move will enable Justice P.B. Varale to read the case records of a challenge launched by Dr. Gitanjali J. Angmo against the Centre for detaining her husband and climate activist Sonam Wangchuk under the National Security Act.

title: Centre moves to restore popular govt. in Manipur, holds review meets
content: Government conducts two security meetings in a week, discusses “pros and cons” of extending President’s Rule, and security deployment in Manipur; Kuki-Zo groups opposed to government formation, remain firm on demand for separate administration

title: Public protests, scarcity of land hampering setting up of dog shelters, says Kerala govt.
content: The Revenue and Local Self-Government departments are in the process of identifying suitable land for new shelters. Once the land is finalised, the Animal Husbandry department will provide technical support for setting up the facilities

title: Minister raps BIAL over Bengaluru airport’s pick-up, parking regulations
content: During the inspection, the Minister also noticed that a portion of the bus bays earmarked for Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) Vayu Vajra airport buses had been taken over, triggering sharp criticism from him

title: Simple language in stories a conscious decision to reach more people: Banu Mushtaq
content: Interestingly, the Booker prize winner dictates poems and short stories to a voice-to-text software in her phone, often when she is travelling, as her work as a lawyer and an activist leaves her little time to sit down and put pen to paper

title: Congress to place legal teams in every district; they will be our eyes and ears: Singhvi
content: The Congress will also constitute a ‘Rapid response force’ of leading lawyers in each State. These teams will be tasked with promptly taking court cases involving the party

title: Centre seeks public comments on draft Pesticides Management Bill to replace 1968 Act
content: The legislation aims to replace the 57-year-old Insecticides Act, 1968, and the Insecticides Rules, 1971, with enhanced penalties for violations.

title: Ernakulam Rural police register 3,908 NDPS cases; 4,138 arrested
content: 603 kg of suspected ganja, more than double the quantity in 2024, and 1.4 kg of suspected MDMA were seized; seven people were jailed under the PITNDPS Act

title: State govt. shares High Court’s satisfaction with SIT probe, says Vasavan
content: On the SIT quizzing former Devaswom Minister Kadakampally Surendran, the Devaswom Minister said the SIT was free to summon or question anyone as part its probe

title: X tells IT Ministry it is ‘in compliance’ with Indian law
content: The social media platform has been scrutinised by the government after its Grok chatbot publicly generated non-consensual sexualised pictures of women

title: Writers cannot stay neutral in times of intolerance, says Kerala Chief Minister
content: Pinarayi and V.D. Satheesan voice their opposition to U.S. attack on Venezuela at the inaugural function of the Kerala Legislature International Book Festival. Legislative Assembly’s award for contributions to literature handed over to writer N.S. Madhavan

title: Over 50 posts vacant in PCB, says report
content: Of the total vacant seats, 19 are in the scientific category; 11 in the engineering wing; and 23 in the administration section

title: Nation must emulate Malappuram’s communal harmony, says Kanthapuram
content: Anyone who has visited the district even once will understand the reality: the warmth and spirit of coexistence of its people,” he says, urging society to salute and adopt the positive examples of the district rather than disparage its people

title: Arrangements in place for Flamingo Festival in Tirupati
content: The event is set to be held at Pulicat Bird Sanctuary in Sullurpeta constituency on January 10 and 11

title: Form special cell to deal with black magic, HC tells govt.
content: Division Bench of Chief Justice Nitin Jamdar and Justice Syam Kumar V.M. suggests this while hearing a public interest litigation  filed by the Kerala Yukthivadi Sangham seeking a legislation similar to those enacted in Maharashtra and Karnataka to prohibit such harmful rituals

title: Sources: Hawks end Young era, send G to Wiz
content: The Hawks are trading four-time All-Star Trae Young to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert, sources said.

title: Jim Harbaugh hails John, hopes he's NFC-bound
content: Jim Harbaugh doesn't expect his older brother John to be out of a job very long but just hopes his next landing spot isn't in the AFC, where the Chargers reside. "As I told him, whatever team he goes to is going to be formidable," Jim said.

title: Scheffler to make '26 debut at American Express
content: World No. 1 Scottie Scheffler will make his 2026 debut at the American Express Championship later this month, tournament officials said Wednesday night. Scheffler also has committed to the WM Phoenix Open.

title: Sources: Rockies, Lorenzen agree to $8M contract
content: Right-hander Michael Lorenzen and the Rockies are in agreement on a one-year, $8 million contract that includes a club option, sources told ESPN.

title: LeBron ruled out vs. Spurs with multiple injuries
content: Lakers star LeBron James will not play against the Spurs on Wednesday -- the second game of a back-to-back -- with the team citing multiple injuries.

title: Cubs land Cabrera, trade top prospect to Marlins
content: The Cubs have acquired pitcher Edward Cabrera in a trade with the Marlins that sends top outfield prospect Owen Caissie, as well as  infield prospects Cristian Hernandez and Edgardo De Leon, to Miami.

title: Jerry Jones: Goal is to retire with most SB wins
content: Cowboys owner Jerry Jones said Wednesday that his goal in life is to the retire as the owner with the most Super Bowl wins and that he has "work to do" to catch the Patriots' Robert Kraft.

title: HOF goalie Hall, who started 502 in a row, dies
content: Glenn Hall, a Hockey Hall of Famer whose streak of 502 consecutive starts as a goaltender remains an NHL record, has died. He was 94.

title: 🏈 Our latest NFL mock draft predicts Picks 1-32
content: Which QB fits with the Raiders at No. 1? How high could Jeremiyah Love go? Will the Buckeyes run the first round? Let's project the first 32 picks for April.

title: Connelly breaks down Miami-Ole Miss, Oregon-Indiana
content: Our deep dive into the semifinals dissects the matchups that will determine who moves on to the title game.

title: Is there a clear winner in the Trae Young trade? Grading the deal for the Hawks, Wizards
content: Trae Young is headed from the Hawks to the Wizards for CJ McCollum and Corey Kispert. Which team fared best? We graded the trade.

title: Roster overhaul, six pillars and the Pittsburgh Steelers: Inside the Kings' latest revamp
content: The Kings fired Mike Brown this time last season, but one year later don't seem any closer to finding their way.

title: Facing the Texans this postseason? Broncos? Seahawks? Good luck! Solak on the three elite NFL defenses
content: This year's playoffs will feature three superior defenses: the Texans, Broncos and Seahawks. What makes each so unstoppable?

title: Wetzel: Welcome to a new college football world, where the SEC is no longer undisputed king
content: The Big Ten is guaranteed to be playing for a third straight national title. Can the SEC find a way to dominate this new era like it did the previous one?

title: Who are MLB's top young stars? Ranking baseball's best players at every age from 16 to 25
content: Julio Rodriguez or Bobby Witt Jr.? Roman Anthony or Jackson Chourio? We rank baseball's best by birth year.

title: Ty Simpson declares for the NFL draft: What does it mean for the QB class, Alabama's next moves?
content: Simpson announced he will enter the 2026 NFL draft. Is he a first-rounder? Which teams could be good fits? And who could replace him at Alabama?

title: Best way to an Eagles defensive lineman's heart -- and performance? Meatballs
content: Vic Fangio introduced the Meatball Award this season for his defense to serve as that extra bit of motivation.

title: Live NBA trade tracker: Details for every deal of the 2025-26 season
content: What deals are getting done in the NBA? Here's every trade of the 2025-26 regular season, starting with the Hawks dealing away franchise star Trae Young.

title: Fresh start or back to square one? Either way, Man United are never dull
content: After the tumult of Ruben Amorim's dismissal, Darren Fletcher and United's 2-2 draw vs. Burnley was fittingly dramatic.

title: VAR review: Did Chelsea get away with what should've been a penalty for Fulham?
content: Chelsea could have given up a penalty to Fulham, but the VAR stuck with the on-field decision. Was it the right call?

title: Amber Glenn is finally ready for her Olympic moment
content: This week, Amber Glenn looks to defend her back-to-back national titles -- and become the oldest U.S. Olympic women's singles skater in 98 years.

title: Power Rankings: Who is really the top team in the Big 12?
content: Texas Tech, one of four unbeaten teams left in women's D-I, and Baylor enter the top 16 as UNC and Notre Dame exit.

title: Inside Raiders' lost 2025 season: Tom Brady's influence, private meetings and dysfunction
content: "Who would want the Raiders job?" The inside story of how the Raiders went from playoff hopes to the No. 1 pick and another fired coach.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Brock Purdy leads in passing TDs, Luther Burden III breaks out in 2026
content: With another fantasy season in the books, Eric Karabell makes some early bold predictions for the 2026 season.

title: How Trevor Lawrence's grill gift was kept a surprise -- and came together
content: The quarterback's grill came from a collaboration of his mom, wife, former Clemson teammate and the Jaguars social media team.

title: 'I had 23': Revisiting the sack ruling that separates Jared Allen and Myles Garrett
content: A 2011 Vikings sack that NFL officials changed a call on seemed to work in Browns' defensive end's favor.

title: Who will be Man United's next manager? 12 top candidates to replace Amorim
content: Whether Manchester United aim to hire quickly or wait until summer, here are the coaches they could be after.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal eye AFCON star Yan Diomande in over $100M deal
content: Arsenal are chasing the Premier League title, but it's not stopping them from exploring a summer deal for RB Leipzig winger Yan Diomande. Transfer Talk has the latest.

title: MLB offseason intel: Trade rumors and free agency updates
content: Here's what we're hearing about Ketel Marte, Alex Bregman, Bo Bichette and much more as the hot stove heats back up.

title: Ranking the top American tennis players as 2026 begins
content: Coco Gauff won another major title in 2025, and Taylor Fritz continued to lead the American men. But who else is set to make a move in 2026?

title: Fast break: Time to take advantage of Joel Embiid's hot streak?
content: Joel Embiid's recent hot stretch of games creates a golden opportunity for fantasy managers, plus other fantasy insights from Eric Moody in his look around the NBA.

title: 4 College Students Killed As Speeding EcoSport Rams Tree In Telangana
content: According to police, an EcoSport car bearing registration number AP31 DT 4899 was travelling at high speed and lost control near Mirzaguda Gate in Chevella. The car then hit the road divider and rammed a tree.

title: "Trump, Give Us Back Nico": Venezuela Protesters Demand Maduro's Return
content: Thousands of people marched in Venezuela Wednesday to demand the release of Nicolas Maduro, toppled and captured in the US assault, while an official video showed grieving relatives mourning those killed in the attack.

title: Renowned Ecologist Madhav Gadgil Dies At 83
content: Noted ecologist Madhav Gadgil, known for his work on the Western Ghats, has passed away in Pune after a brief illness, family sources said on Thursday.

title: 'Marathi Manoos' Will Be Powerless If BJP Rules Civic Bodies: Raj Thackeray
content: MNS chief Raj Thackeray has launched a scathing attack on the BJP, alleging that those seeking to separate Mumbai from Maharashtra are in power at the Centre and in the state.

title: Bill Threatening 500% Tariff On India For Russia Oil Trade Gets Trump's Nod
content: US President Donald Trump has "greenlit" the bipartisan Russia Sanctions Bill, which could be used to penalise Moscow's trading partners, including India, China and Brazil, over their purchase of Russian oil, said Republican Senator Lindsey Graham.

title: "DMK Long-Term Ally": Congress MP Manickam Tagore On Tamil Nadu Polls
content: With the 2026 Tamil Nadu Assembly elections drawing closer, Congress MP Manickam Tagore sought to dispel speculation about any rift within the INDIA bloc in the state, asserting that the Congress and the DMK remain firmly aligned.

title: ONGC Oil Well Fire Under Control In Andhra, Residents Allowed To Return Home
content: After three days of firefighting and blowout control operations, authorities have declared it safe for residents evacuated from villages near the ONGC gas well fire in Andhra Pradeshs Dr. BR Ambedkar Konaseema district to return home.

title: Grok Obscenity Row: X Sends Detailed Reply, Why Government Isn't Satisfied
content: The government has asked X for more details, including specific action taken on obscene content linked to its Grok AI and measures to prevent a repeat in future, sources said, adding that the platform's reply, while detailed, is not adequate.

title: 100 Died In US Attack That Ousted Maduro, Says Venezuela's Minister
content: Venezuela's interior minister Diosdado Cabello said late on Wednesday that 100 people died in the US attack which removed President Nicolas Maduro from power on Saturday.

title: $50,000 A Month: How Cash-Strapped Pak Lobbied Hard In US After Op Sindoor
content: Cash-strapped Pakistan, amid its severe economic crisis, spent millions of dollars to lobby its agenda in Washington, exposing the massive scale of diplomatic pressure Islamabad unleashed as it struggled to blunt India's Op Sindoor response.

title: Venezuela To Purchase Only US-Made Products Under Oil Deal: Trump
content: In a major announcement, US President Donald Trump said on Wednesday that Venezuela would now purchase only American-made products with the money they receive from the new oil deal.

title: "Darkest Day Of My Life": Vedanta Chairman's Son Dies Of Heart Attack
content: Vedanta Chairman Anil Agarwal expressed grief over the sudden death of his son, Agnivesh Agarwal, who died at the age of 49 following a cardiac arrest in New York.

title: US Immigration Agent Shoots And Kills Woman During Crackdown In Minneapolis
content: An Immigration and Customs Enforcement officer shot and killed a Minneapolis motorist on Wednesday during the Trump administration's latest immigration crackdown in a US city  a shooting that federal officials claimed was an act of self-defense

title: Manipur Violence: Court Orders Forensic Probe Of 48-Minute Audio Clip
content: The Supreme Court on Wednesday ordered forensic examination of the entire 48-minute audio recording which a plea has alleged that the leaked clip points to the role of former Manipur chief minister N Biren Singh in the 2023 ethnic violence.

title: US Tried To Buy Greenland Thrice, And Failed
content: President Donald Trumps renewed interest in acquiring Greenland from Denmark fits into a long, little-known pattern in US history.

title: Breaking American Laws Can Have "Serious Consequences": US Warns Students
content: The US Embassy in India on Wednesday said breaking American laws can have "serious consequences" for a student visa, as it termed a sojourn in the country a privilege, not a right.

title: 1st Phase Of Census 2027 To Take Place Between April-September
content: The first phase of Census 2027-- houselisting operations-- will take place between April 1 and September 30 this year in all states and Union territories over a 30-day period specified by each state and UT, a government notification said.

title: Actor Urmila Sanawar Questioned By Police In Ankita Bhandari Murder Case
content: Urmila Sanawar, the actress who caused a political storm in Uttarakhand with fresh allegations in the Ankita Bhandari murder case, was questioned by the police for several hours on Wednesday.

title: Trump Invites Colombian President To White House Amid Dispute
content: US President Donald Trump said Wednesday he was arranging to meet with his Colombian counterpart Gustavo Petro "in the near future," days after threatening military action against the South American nation.

title: 'Anti-National Activity Won't Be Tolerated': JNU On Slogans Against PM Modi
content: A protest at JNU sparked a controversy as objectionable slogans targeting Prime Minister Narendra Modi and Union Home Minister Amit Shah were allegedly raised over the denial of bail by the Supreme Court to Umar Khalid and Sharjeel Imam

title: Govt approves Rs 1,800 cr for new high-security printing line for banknotes, passports
content: the govt has approved a proposal for setting up a new cylindrical mould watermark banknote line with an annual capacity to produce 6,000 tonnes of high-security paper . the new line — a set of machines — will replace two of the three lines at the security paper mill, Narmadapuram in Madhya Pradesh .

title: College football transfer portal: Tracking who's on the move
content: Max Olson ranks Cincinnati's Brendan Sorsby as the top player in the transfer portal and predicts a recruitment battle between Texas Tech and LSU. (1:04) College football's transfer portal officially opened at midnight ET on Jan. 2. However, players have been announcing their intentions to transfer since the regular season ended. By midday on Day 1, more than 4,500 Division I college football players have entered the transfer portal. Players now have until Jan. 16 to enter their name to transfer. It doesn't mean they have to find their new schools by then -- or that they can't return to their previous schools. We are tracking the notable players entering the portal as well as those players who will re-sign with their current schools. Here's the latest news and updates on how the 2026 season could be transformed.

title: Reranking Freshman of the Year contenders
content: the top 10 recruits in the 2025 SC Next 100 rankings were averaging 17.8 points in 2026 . most of those players will be found in our updated freshman rankings below . some of these players could hit the "freshman wall" with conference play in full swing .

title: NFL futures: Seahawks enter playoffs as Super Bowl favorites, Rams right behind
content: The top two teams in the NFC West have the best odds to win the Super Bowl heading into the playoffs. The  Seattle Seahawks  are the favorites to win Super Bowl 60, following closely by the division rival  Los Angeles Rams . The AFC West-winning  Denver Broncos  have the third-best odds to win the Super Bowl as the top overall seed in the AFC. They, like the Seahawks, will have a bye in the first round. Here are the Super Bowl odds and conference championship odds for every team still in the hunt. Note: Odds by  DraftKings Sportsbook  and subject to change.
